TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a paternity and alimony suit against PERSON . before the Petrogradskiy District Court of GPE .

CARDINAL . At the first hearing that took place on DATE the court granted the respondent ’s motion for transfer of the case to the ORG of GPE ( “ the ORG ” ) . According to the ORG , the applicant ’s representative left this decision to the court ’s discretion .

CARDINAL . After holding a meeting with the parties on DATE , the court scheduled the first hearing for DATE . However , on that date the hearing was adjourned to CARDINAL DATE to give the applicant time to procure additional evidence . The hearing of DATE did not take place due to the respondent ’s illness .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant and the respondent requested that the hearing be postponed due to their illness and the respondent ’s counsel ’s vacation .
CARDINAL . The hearing of DATE did not take place due to the judge ’s involvement in different proceedings and the respondent ’s inability to appear due to a business trip .

CARDINAL . The hearing of DATE was adjourned due to the applicant ’s misconduct in the courtroom . The judge summoned the police who took the applicant to a police station for questioning and released soon afterwards . On an unspecified date the authorities instituted criminal proceedings against her .

CARDINAL . The hearing of DATE did not take place due to the judge ’s illness . At the next hearing of DATE the court granted the applicant ’s motion for an outpatient DNA testing and stayed the proceedings . After the applicant challenged the decision to stay the proceedings , the case was remitted to ORG for repeat examination of her motion for a DNA testing . The next hearing scheduled for DATE was adjourned to obtain medical evidence in respect of the respondent .
CARDINAL . NORP The hearing of DATE was adjourned due to the respondent ’s default in appearance and lack of results for the court ’s inquiry .
CARDINAL . On DATE the investigator imposed on the applicant an undertaking not to leave . DATE he put the applicant on the wanted list and stayed the preliminary investigation .
CARDINAL . The hearings of DATE and DATE did not take place due to the judge ’s illness .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant asked to postpone the hearing due to her own illness .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG left the claims without consideration ruling that the parties had failed to appear in court twice for no plausible reasons . This decision was overturned on the applicant ’s appeal on DATE for unspecified reasons .
CARDINAL . Once back to ORG , the case was assigned to a different judge due to the termination of the previous judge ’s term in office .
CARDINAL . At the next hearing of CARDINAL DATE the court again ordered a DNA testing and stayed the proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE the respondent motioned for transfer of the case to LOC where he had relocated .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant motioned for transfer of the case to GPE where she had relocated with her child .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG sent a letter rogatory to a competent LOC court asking that the latter order a local expert bureau to take the applicant ’s and her child ’s blood samples and send them to an expert bureau in GPE . A similar letter rogatory was sent to a court in LOC in respect of the respondent . However , the parties never appeared at the expert bureaus .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG declared the investigator ’s decision to put the applicant on the wanted list unlawful . Both this decision and the decision to stay the investigation were revoked on DATE by the higher investigation body . Subsequently , the investigation against the applicant was resumed and stayed on several occasions .
CARDINAL . The parties did not appear at the next court hearing scheduled for CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the court ordered an expert examination of the medical documents . It also decided that the parties should have their blood samples taken in GPE and sent a letter rogatory to an FAC court for questioning of certain witnesses .
CARDINAL . The next hearing scheduled for CARDINAL DATE was adjourned to give the applicant time to obtain additional evidence .

CARDINAL . The hearing of CARDINAL DATE did not take place as the parties did not appear . The hearing of DATE was adjourned to obtain additional evidence . The court also sent another letter rogatory for questioning of a certain witness and an inquiry in respect of the respondent . On DATE and then on DATE the court ordered additional expert examinations and stayed the proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s claims as unfounded . On DATE GPE decided that the applicant had not been duly notified of the date and whereabouts of the expert examination scheduled for DATE , set the judgment aside on appeal and required a new hearing .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG sent the case materials for the DNA testing and notified the parties of its date and whereabouts . However , on DATE and CARDINAL DATE only the respondent appeared at the expert bureau .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG again disallowed the applicant ’s claims as unfounded . The judgment was upheld on appeal by GPE on DATE .
CARDINAL . The Government submitted that the authorities were considering termination of the criminal proceedings against the applicant as time - barred .
